text:
Geez, so MoneyLion is behind ENGINE, a platform for borrowers to meet lenders. So, I submitted my request, gave my bank details, my socia security number, bank info, and where I work. 
The website, quickly made a contract and all i had to do was click the box with e-signature. Of course, I didn't because the amount offered was less than 10% of what I requested. 
The loan company was MaxLend, and they were expecting me to sign a 704% interest rate. Yes, SEVEN HUNDRED FOUR PERCENT interest rate. with payment of $300+ for every biweekly pay period. The loan amount was for $1050. The payback was $5,000+. How could this platform allow this finance company onto their platform.
title: Money Sharks lurking in their platform pool

reply.message: Hi there, thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We’re really sorry to hear about the situation you encountered when looking for a loan, and absolutely agree that transparency and fairness are critical when it comes to financial products. We understand how frustrating it is to see loan offers with high rates, and we truly appreciate your feedback here. If you have additional feedback, we'd be happy to hear what you think - feel free to complete this form: https://mlion.info/customerhelp, and a member of our Advocacy Team will contact you directly.

text:
I am writing this review to warn everyone to stay far away from the Moneylion app. They falsely advertise that they help improve your credit score, but in my experience, they did the exact opposite and actively damaged it further.
Their methods are unclear and seem designed to mislead users. Despite their promises, I saw a significant decrease in my credit score after using their services. When I tried to contact their customer support, it was unresponsive and unhelpful, offering no explanation or resolution for the negative impact they had.
This app is not just ineffective; it is actively harmful. If you are looking to improve your credit, Moneylion is the last place you should turn. They are a scam preying on people's financial vulnerabilities and will only make your situation worse.
title: BEWARE! Money Lyin is a SCAM that HARMS Your Credit!

text: One star because I couldn’t give zero. Moneylion used to be good to me and something changed about a year ago and now it’s just unbelievable. They offer products but when you go to link your bank account to the product so you can utilize them they don’t even List their own bank. Money line is an option so for the loans and the “credit building perks“ are virtually useless. But they sure take out their fees every month they send you random options for Credit building and then or cash advances etc., and when you try to take advantage of them, and of course you have to have a MoneyLion account to do this BUT!!  your Moneylion account IS NOT an option to repay the loans or the advances so they are useless.  I can’t take advantage of ANY OF THE SO-CALLED ADVANTAGES BECAUSE THEY DON’T EVEN ACCEPT THEMSELVES AS A REPAYMENT OPTION!!  BECAUSE THEY’RE NOT A BANK I GUESS IT’S RIDICULOUS. I HAD AT LEAST FIVE LOANS WITH THEM ALL IN GOOD STANDING ALL PAID OFF ON TIME AND THEN SUDDENLY I DIDN’T QUALIFY OR BETTER YET I COULDN’T REPAY THEM WITH MY MONEYLION ROLL MONEY ACCOUNT BECAUSE IT WASN’T LISTED AS A REPAYMENT OPTION SO I WENT TO THE WOW ACCOUNT JUST TO HAVE THE SAME NONSENSE. THE ONLY REASON I KEEP THIS ACCOUNT IS BECAUSE I DON’T WANNA GO THROUGH THE HASSLE OF CHANGING MY SOCIAL SECURITY PAYMENT AND THEY DO ALLOW ME INSTA CASH SINCE I’M WRITING THIS THEY’LL PROBABLY CUT THAT OFF TOO..  welcome to Moneylion y’all oh and if you try and get a manager, they just hang up on you or tell you that you’ll get the same response and then they tell you that there’s no way possible no human can override their algorithms if it were me, I’d probably start looking at mysystem because we’re real people and not everybody lives on algorithm and if you can’t control your own company and override things I would look at some different software whatever it is what it is.
title: Oh, it is what it is! Get used to itOne star because I couldn’t give zero
